title: Headless on Ubuntu server issue
body:
### Bug Description

When i try to run browser use on ubuntu server, i face with issue headless:true or use with xvfb but while trying to fix this issue with headless:true with the instructions on documentation, it is not working either. I also looked for the issue and see lot of people facing same problem.

### Reproduction Steps

1.pip install browser-use
2.pip install playwright
3.playwright install
4.nano v1.txt
5.python v1.txt

### Code Sample

```python
import asyncio
from browser_use import Agent
from browser_use.agent.views import AgentHistoryList
from langchain_ollama import ChatOllama
from browser_use.browser.browser import Browser, BrowserConfig
 
config = BrowserConfig(
    headless=True,
)
 
browser = Browser(config=config)
 
async def run_search() -> AgentHistoryList:
    agent = Agent(
        task="Search for a 'browser use' post on the r/LocalLLaMA subreddit and open it.",
        llm=ChatOllama(
            model="qwen2.5:7b",
            num_ctx=32000,
            browser=browser,
            generate_gif=False,
        ),
    )
 
    result = await agent.run()
    return result
 
 
async def main():
    result = await run_search()
    print("\n\n", result)
 
 
if __name__ == "__main__":
    asyncio.run(main())
```

### Version

0.1.36

### LLM Model

Local Model (Specify model in description)

### Operating System

Ubuntu 22.04

### Relevant Log Output

```shell

```
author: omertascioglu

comments.body: does headless work?

I handle it by using xvfb:
- sudo apt install xvfb

Then while using browser-use
- xvfb-run -a python filename

title: Message Box will not accept text
body:
### Bug Description

The message box will not accept any text both while the operator is running as well as when paused.  The cursor appears, but when you begin typing no text appears.  There is no way to get the Operator back on track when it goes off the rails which is every time it runs.  It renders this completely useless.  Also the pause button often causes the operator to crash with no way to resume it.  


### Reproduction Steps

The message box will not accept any text both while the operator is running as well as when paused.  The cursor appears, but when you begin typing no text appears.  There is no way to get the Operator back on track when it goes off the rails which is every time it runs.  It renders this completely useless.  Also the pause button often causes the operator to crash with no way to resume it.  


### Code Sample

```python
NA
```

### Version

web

### LLM Model

Other (specify in description)

### Operating System

Windows 11  browser microsoft edge and chrome

### Relevant Log Output

```shell
I am using whatever model is used for the web/cloud version.
```
author: ReduceMyIns

comments.body: Bug still exists in cloud

title: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'startswith'
body:
### Bug Description

Anything above 0.1.30 gives me a `'NoneType' object has no attribute 'startswith'` and won't drive the browser.
What am i doing wrong? What happened between 0.1.30 and newer versions?


### Reproduction Steps

```
INFO     [browser_use] BrowserUse logging setup complete with level info

[...]
        
INFO     [agent] ðŸ“ Step 1
ERROR    [agent] âŒ Result failed 1/3 times:
 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'startswith'
INFO     [agent] ðŸ“ Step 1
ERROR    [agent] âŒ Result failed 2/3 times:
 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'startswith'
INFO     [agent] ðŸ“ Step 1
ERROR    [agent] âŒ Result failed 3/3 times:
 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'startswith'
ERROR    [agent] âŒ Stopping due to 3 consecutive failures
```

```
$ pip freeze | grep browser
browser-use==0.1.31

$ playwright --version
Version 1.49.1

$ python --version
Python 3.12.3
```

### Code Sample

```python
from langchain_openai import AzureChatOpenAI
from browser_use import Agent, Browser, BrowserConfig
import asyncio
from dotenv import load_dotenv
import os

load_dotenv()

async def main():
    # Initialize the model
    llm = AzureChatOpenAI(
        azure_deployment="[REDACTED]",
        api_version="2024-05-01-preview",
        temperature=0,
        max_tokens=None,
        timeout=None,
        max_retries=2,
    )

    # Basic configuration for the browser
    config = BrowserConfig(
        headless=False,
        disable_security=True  # Uncomment if you want to disable security
    )

    # Initialize the browser with the specified configuration
    browser = Browser(config=config)

    agent = Agent(
        task="What is a dugong?",
        llm=llm,
        browser=browser,
        use_vision=True,
        generate_gif=False
    )

    try:
        result = await agent.run()
        # display(result.action_results())
        print('--------------------------')
        for action in result.action_results():
            if action.is_done:
                print(action.extracted_content)
        print('--------------------------')
        # Close the browser after completion
        await browser.close()
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Error occurred: {str(e)}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
```

### Version

0.1.31

### LLM Model

GPT-4o in Azure OpenAI

### Operating System

Ubuntu 24.04
author: snobu

comments.body:
Have the same issue but with using MacOS. Can someone confirm if this is an LLM model issue or something internal SDK response handler function. If it works well with ChatGPT API, I can use that instead. 

Thanks a lot for this project. 

## Version
(venv) âžœ  agents-on-steroids pip freeze | grep browser
browser-use==0.1.36

(venv) âžœ  agents-on-steroids playwright --version
Version 1.50.0

(venv) âžœ  agents-on-steroids python --version
Python 3.13.1
Is it fixed?

This pull request includes a small but important change to the `browser_use/dom/buildDomTree.js` file. The change adds a check for a specific class to determine if an element should be considered interactive.

* [`browser_use/dom/buildDomTree.js`](diffhunk://#diff-8f70f7a52b8e76e1c2669b77e09c25410507572b842d6503a101290ef135793fR159-R164): Added a check for the `address-input__container__input` class to the `hasInteractiveRole` condition to ensure elements with this class are recognized as interactive.

@MagMueller could you elaborate on why such a hard-coded check was necessary i.e. why this class?

btw. this PR added a redundant whitespace

title: Briefly explane dom/views.py
body:
Hey @GatienBoquet amazing work !!

Just needed to understand the use of creating custom dom structure .. ? Is that for consistent automation ? Please share a usecase for it ..
a brief explanation would be highly appreciated ..
author: complete-dope

comments.body:
Hi
The two founder are @MagMueller   / @gregpr07 kudos to them !
I'll add this explantation to an article i'm writing.
But briefly, the custom DOM structure is designed to be easier for LLMs to understand.

No worries , Got through the code and understood it 

Authors used some pretty good methods

So the main purpose of the extraction is to reduce Tokens. So that we only present the LLM whats interactable.

Gregor did this extraction and by parsing the HTML into this dictionary, we can calculate hashes for paths and attributes to find them later again on the page, if the page is changing.

title: Suggest using litellm to support more models
body:
LiteLLM has translated the APIs of many models into OpenAI's format, which simplifies integration across various models. By adopting LiteLLM, this project can benefit from reduced effort in handling multiple models, allowing developers to focus more on core functionalities.

I believe this can improve development efficiency and reduce maintenance overhead.

Thank you for your amazing work on this project! Looking forward to your thoughts.
author: xlbljz

comments.body: Langchain also helps in the same way right? In fact since it is a python library, arguably better no? You can  still opt to use LiteLLM by using `langchain-openai` and setting baseUrl etc. since LiteLLM exposes OpenAI layer.
So you would keep langchain (or replace it?) and call ChatOpenAI with a LiteLLM URL?

But why does it say other models like Gemini is coming soon in the doc. 
Is it because different models require different tuning?

I'm using LM Studio locally and use langchain_openai to use browser_use for that reason.
The think is, with langchain you can make browser_use LLM agnostic.
Gemini is already supported and working well too.

Langchain and litellm don't have the same use case. Instead of chatopenai you could use chatlitellm, both by langchain. This way you could minimally change the code but add the support for basically any LLM and providers. Litellm is really nice!

> Langchain and litellm don't have the same use case. Instead of chatopenai you could use chatlitellm, both by langchain. This way you could minimally change the code but add the support for basically any LLM and providers. Litellm is really nice!

Langchain even support litellm! That's amazing. I didn't know that. Thanks for sharing.

title: disable bounding boxes
body:
Is there a way to disable the bounding boxes that are displayed on the browser/screenshot ? ( i mean not draw them on the browser/screenshot ) ? 

Thanks in advance
author: DecentMakeover

comments.body: As in, you want to `use_vision` but not have bounding boxes? I think this is achievable if we remove the highlights after image is taken for AI request.
@shyam-king let me check

Yes you can

```

async with await browser.new_context() as context:
        page = await context.get_current_page()

        agent = Agent(
            task="Go to google.com and search for 'python programming'",
            llm=llm,
            browser_context=context,
        )

        # Start the agent
        agent_task = asyncio.create_task(agent.run())


        try:
            while True:
                # Remove highlights before taking screenshot
                await context.remove_highlights()

                # Take a clean screenshot
                screenshot = await page.screenshot(
                    animations='disabled'
                )

        except Exception as e:
            print(f"Stream error: {e}")
            await agent_task.cancel()
            await browser.close()

```
Be great if this is documented or rather just an argument we pass to `Agent`. The answer above also actually quickly removes them rather than disable them.

title: [Enhancement] Improve input state information about the content we cut out
body:
We do not include the entire website state, because its too big. We only include whats visable on screen and cut the rest.

Therefore, we should include information inside the state what we cut out. E.g. in the end of the state, we could write things like
- .... 100 words more  or
- ... 5 pages more or
- <cut content> use scroll to see more or
- for more content call extract content
author: MagMueller

comments.body: +1 on the scroll part

title: Feature: Disallow Google AI Overview on search
body:
- Added Google param that turns off the Google AI overview feature
Removed the overview since browser use agents have a tendency to always use the data from them, thus defeating the purpose of digging deeper into multiple pages. This is especially useful when trying to get data within a certain time period, ie: 2025 where the Google AI overview will cite pages from far before 2020
author: Michaelgathara

comments.body: Could potentially make this a flag the user passes in when they initialize the agent as well, let me know if that is a more preferred approach
Agree, makes sense

title: Added post/reply X functionality
body:
This PR allows you to automate posting on X

It supports:

- Posting new tweets
- Tagging users
- Replying to tweets

Note

Add your target user and message in the config section.
-- target_user="XXXXX"
-- message="XXXXX"
-- reply_url="XXXXX"

Any issues, contact me on X @defichemist95

comments.body: Good example :)

title: Create Online_coding_agent.py
body:
This pull request introduces a new feature that automates the process of opening an online code editor, writing code, and executing it using a browser-based agent system. 

agent1: Opens an online code editor (Programiz).
executor: Executes the code written by the coder and suggests updates if there are errors.
coder: Writes and completes code for a simple calculator on the coding interface.
author: D-Yuva

comments.body: Whatâ€™s the use case?

> Whatâ€™s the use case?

Beginners can use it to practice coding without worrying about setting up an environment, it opens an editor, lets you write code, and runs it automatically. Itâ€™s also helpful for quick prototyping or debugging when you just need to test something small without opening a full IDE. More like a coding assistant in real time
Great idea, I was going to build this for myself, how far along did you get?

> Great idea, I was going to build this for myself, how far along did you get?

Done with everything, at times the agent has some problem in identifying the coding space that being unrecognisable
sure haha, I'll merge it. Just please make the filename lowercase

> sure haha, I'll merge it. Just please make the filename lowercase

done mate

title: Add example files for better documentation and reference
body:
This PR adds essential example files to the examples directory to improve documentation and provide better reference for users:

- Added .env.example for environment configuration reference
- Added .gitignore for proper version control setup
- Added cli.py demonstrating CLI implementation
- Added LICENSE file (MIT)
- Added README.md with documentation
- Added requirements.txt for dependency management

These files will help new users better understand the project setup and configuration, while providing clear examples of implementation.

title: Grok Integration?
body:
Has anybody tried to use this with Groq? I'm getting an `invalid_api_key` error. Please close this issue if it's something stupid I'm doing, and Groq should work fine. Here's a script for reference.

```
from langchain_groq import ChatGroq
#from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from browser_use import Agent
import asyncio

async def main():
    agent = Agent(
        task="Are there cheap flights from ... to ...?",
        llm=ChatGroq(model="llama3-8b-8192"),
    )
    result = await agent.run()
    print(result)

asyncio.run(main())
```
Thanks.
author: NathanielComeau

comments.body:
I just checked and it works for me. Try putting the env variable before the script when you run it (e.g. GROQ_API_KEY=XXX python test.py)

Also your issue title mentions 'Grok', check if you're referring to the model from xAI or groq.com provider

Okay, thank you very much for checking it @sbhavani .

Aha! Yes, I was looking to try it out with 'Grok', so that explains why my xAI API key wasn't working.

Thanks very much.

just a note, I got this (kinda) working with Groq with the following. It doesn't complete the full flow but it does open chromium:

```
from langchain_groq import ChatGroq
#from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from browser_use import Agent
import asyncio

async def main():
    agent = Agent(
        task="Are there cheap flights from AUS to LAX?",
        llm=ChatGroq(model="llama-3.3-70b-versatile"),
    )
    result = await agent.run()
    print(result)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    asyncio.run(main())
```

In terminal, I run:
`GROQ_API_KEY=api_key_here python groqtest.py`

Note, don't call your python script "groq.py" or you'll end up in a circular dependency error
looks like it fails because Groq models are not multi-modal
@gregpr07  please check this out
Oh wait haha, I didnâ€™t see you already worked on this. THANK YOU! Will merge in a few hours
Cool, let me know if you want any changes

title: Allow headless option when initializing controller
